title: Gallery Talk: Art and Poetry Across the Collection
hero_caption: <p>Arthur Dove. <em>A Reasonable Facsimile</em>, 1942. Alfred Stieglitz Collection.&nbsp;</p>
description:
What does it mean to “see” a poem rather than read it? How has poetry shaped the content, production, and interpretation of visual art across time and cultures? This tour with museum educator Paulina Lopez will explore the ways artists have bridged image and verse, ranging from ancient Chinese scrolls to modern American works.

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.
